title: Iowa 13-year-old accused of killing 15-year-old in accidental shooting
content:
CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa (AP) — Cedar Rapids police have arrested a 13-year-old boy in connection with the fatal shooting of another teen.
City officials announced Wednesday that police arrested the teen Tuesday and charged him with involuntary manslaughter in connection with the March 18th shooting of 15-year-old Senquez Jackson, who died the next day. Officials say the shooting was unintentional.
The 13-year-old is also charged with carrying weapons, preventing apprehension and obstructing prosecution.
The 13-year-old thought the gun was not loaded, after he pulled the ammo clip from the handle of a small, 38-caliber automatic pistol; but there was still a bullet in the gun, according to a report from KCRG.
The 13-year-old was held at the Linn County Juvenile Detention Center.
